body.p:
Carlisle April 2d. 1864
To his Excellency Gov. Bramblet
Dear Sir. Your Petitioner Andrew Blount was fined by a Judgment of the Nicholas Circuit Court at its March Term 1859 in the sum of $30 for gambling
He says he was under an impression that the amount had been remitted by your predecessor, but finds he was mistaken
He says he has lately been discharged from the Federal Army ^Co. H. 18th Ky. Regt.^ for disability and is unable to work.

He says he cannot pay this Judgment without distress to himself & family; that he is poor, owns no land & dependent on the very limited ability he has now to work & manage for the support fo this family. He has a wife in poor health & five children dependent entirely upon him.
He prays you will remit the Judgment above. A Blount
We are acquaintances of Andrew Blount & believe the statements above. We recommend the prayer of the Petition April 1864

Fitch Munger
John M. Chevis.
W. B. Hopkins.
William S. Waugh 2nd Leut infry ^Ky^
Marshus T Kirry
L. M. Campbell

Remit except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
Nicholas Cir Ct
vs
Andrew Blount
$30
I believe this is a meritorious case & the Judgment could be remitted with great propriety The Sheriff has the execution & money must soon be paid or Blount must go to Jail yours &c.
